workshop.controllers.internal.rest

Class PositionsRestController

  • java.lang.Object
    • workshop.controllers.internal.rest.WorkshopRestControllerAbstract<Position>
      • workshop.controllers.internal.rest.PositionsRestController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WorkshopRestController<Position>

    @RestController
 @RequestMapping(path="/internal/positions",
                produces="application/hal+json;charset=UTF-8")
 @ExposesResourceFor(value=Position.class)
public class PositionsRestController
extends WorkshopRestControllerAbstract<Position>

    • Method Detail

      • deletePositionEmployeeForbidden

        @DeleteMapping(path="/{id}/employees/{employeeId}")
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasPermission(\'Employee\', \'delete\') or hasPermission(\'Employee\', \'put\')")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> deletePositionEmployeeForbidden(@PathVariable(name="id")
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               java.lang.Long id,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               @PathVariable(name="employeeId")
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               java.lang.Long employeeId)
        The Employee entity cannot exist without Position set. So it cannot be just removed from Employee.
        Returns:
        HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN with a hint to use Post or Put methods instead to replace a Position.

      • deletePositionInternalAuthority

        @DeleteMapping(path="{id}/internal-authorities/{authorityId}")
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasPermission(\'InternalAuthority\', \'put\')")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> deletePositionInternalAuthority(@PathVariable(name="id")
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.Long id,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        @PathVariable(name="authorityId")
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.Long authorityId)
        Just removes an InternalAuthority from a given Position.
        Parameters:
        id - Position.ID
        authorityId - Authority.ID to be deleted from Position
        Returns:
        HttpStatus.NO_CONTENT in case of success.

        @RequestMapping(path={"/{id}/department/{departmentId}","/{id}/department/"},
                method={POST,PUT,DELETE},
                consumes={"application/json;charset=UTF-8","multipart/form-data"})
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasPermission(\'Department\', \'put\') or hasPermission(\'Department\', \'post\') or hasPermission(\'Department\', \'delete\')")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> positionDepartmentForbiddenMethods(@PathVariable(name="id")

      • postForbiddenMethodPositionInternalAuthority

        @PostMapping(path="/{id}/internal-authorities",
             consumes={"application/json;charset=UTF-8","multipart/form-data"})
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasPermission(\'InternalAuthority\', \'post\')")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> postForbiddenMethodPositionInternalAuthority(@PathVariable(name="id")
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.Long id,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        @Validated(value=PersistenceValidation.class) @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        InternalAuthority internalAuthority,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        New InternalAuthorities have to be persisted with their dedicated controller!
        Returns:
        HttpStatus.FORBIDDEN with a message advises using WorkshopRestControllerAbstract.postOne(WorkshopEntity, BindingResult, WebRequest) post method for persisting.

      • postPositionEmployee

        @PostMapping(path="/{id}/employees",
             consumes={"application/json;charset=UTF-8","multipart/form-data"})
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasPermission(\'Employee\', \'post\') or hasPermission(\'Position\', \'put\')")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> postPositionEmployee(@PathVariable(name="id")
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.Long id,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Employee employee,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult)
        Parameters:
        id - Position.ID to set a new Employee to.
        employee - Employee to be set to this Position
        Returns:
        The persisted Employee with this Position set.

      • putPositionEmployee

        @PutMapping(path="/{id}/employees",
            consumes={"application/json;charset=UTF-8","multipart/form-data"})
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasPermission(\'Employee\', \'put\')")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> putPositionEmployee(@PathVariable(name="id")
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.Long id,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        @Validated(value=MergingValidation.class) @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Employee employee,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult)
        Parameters:
        id - Another Position.ID to set an existing Employee to.
        employee - Employee to be reset to this Position
        Returns:
        The updated Employee with this Position set.

      • putPositionInternalAuthority

        @PutMapping(path="/{id}/internal-authorities",
            consumes={"application/json;charset=UTF-8","multipart/form-data"})
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasPermission(\'InternalAuthority\', \'put\')")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> putPositionInternalAuthority(@PathVariable(name="id")
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     java.lang.Long id,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     @Validated(value=MergingValidation.class) @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     InternalAuthority internalAuthority,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult)
        Adds another existing InternalAuthority to the given Position
        Parameters:
        id - Position.ID to add a new InternalAuthority to.
        internalAuthority - An existing InternalAuthority to be added.
        Returns:
        HttpStatus.ACCEPTED with the renewed InternalAuthority.
